Whatever content

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)

data <- read_csv("data/cases.csv")


```


```{r}
plot_data <- data |>
    separate(
        case_nr,
        into = c("region", "court_nr"),
        sep = ","
    ) |>
    mutate(
        year = as.numeric(substr(month, 1, 4))
    ) |>
    group_by(region, year) |>
    count() |>
    group_by(region) |>
    filter(sum(n) > 50)

selectYear <- 2010

favoriten <- plot_data |>
    filter(year == 2010 & region == "BG Favoriten") |>
    pull(n)

innere <- plot_data |>
    filter(year == selectYear & region == "BG Innere Stadt Wien") |>
    pull(n)


```

The number of cases in Favoriten in `{r} selectYear` was `{r} favoriten`, while in Innere Stadt it was `{r} innere`.
 So the numerb in Favoriten is <span style="color:{r} color" >{r} word</span>
